p.s: The comment Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't' written by John Worne and published in the daily newspaper The Telegraph on 27th January 2015 deals with the speaking of foreign languages in the United KingdomsUnited Kingdom and the importance of this topic.
Firstly the author points out that the number of persons who speak a foreign language is going down.
But there is also a progress at primary schools because there is also the number of students with a foreign language fallen.
Furthermore Worne criticizes people, who think that English is a language which you can speak all over the world and a translator for example is not reliable.
Besides the author means that foreign languages are important for the future of the country and for yourself.
It has a decisive influence on your job because of the fast-growing market you need this skill.
But Worne thinks there is also a positive point because students can study a language and another degree course.
Moreover the author points out that a person with a foreign language skill rather getgets a job than a person without this skill.
All in all the text deals with the importance of foreign languages for the future of people.
